knimeNode.name: Substructure Search
knimeNode.shortDescription: Filters molecules based on a fragment

intro.p: This node allows you to draw a fragment in the dialog. Upon execution the molecules from the input table are divided into two sets, one with all molecules that contain the fragments, the other with all molecules that do not contain it.
intro.i: This node can process the input table in parallel. However, by default the usage of threads is disabled in the CDK plugin, because the CDK code may not be thread-safe in all places. If you want to enable multi-threading, change the setting in the KNIME preferences.

fullDescription.option: Use the control options to assemble a structure. If a previously drawn molecule does not show up when opening the dialog, you may need to scroll down the editor pane.
Select the column that contains the molecules.

ports.inPort: Table that contains at least one column with CDK molecules.
ports.outPort: Table with all molecules that contain the fragment.
Table with all molecules that do not contain the fragment.
